Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type A kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower with added red centre and added white outline; exterior: dilute line at top of rim; below lion (shoulder, mane and top of foreleg remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: Lemos identifies the sherd as belonging to a Chalice Style chalice. However, the depiction of the lion is very close to the rim of the vessel suggesting that there were two friezes on the exterior surface of the vessel. Such friezes are found on Type A kantharoi. For parallels, see Williams 1983, 169-171, fig. 12. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983. Lemos also included the 1924 registration number which is an incorrect registration number. Numerous sherds were given duplicate numbers in 1924. However, the registration number 1924,1201.1283 which she gives is also incorrect and should be 1924,1201.1223.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 287, no. 839, pl. 117)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1656) (phase 2)
